description: Adds or removes permission settings for the specified snapshot.
mitreAttackTechniques: T1537 - Transfer Data to Cloud Account

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: By adding permissions to a snapshot, attackers can grant access to unauthorized cloud accounts or default accounts, which can be used for persistence and privilege escalation.
Adding permissions to a snapshot might expose sensitive files that contain credentials, aiding in credential access.
Removing permissions from a snapshot can be used to hide or delete evidence of unauthorized access, aiding in defense evasion.
By modifying snapshot permissions, attackers can gain access to sensitive data stored within snapshots, aiding in data collection and exfiltration.
Modifying permissions could impair security controls or defenses by granting unauthorized access to the snapshots, potentially containing security-related configurations, backups, or tools.
Modifying snapshot permissions could help attackers discover cloud accounts with access to the snapshot, aiding in further attacks.
If a snapshot contains OS-level files, attackers can use it to extract credentials, aiding in credential access.
Snapshots can be used to stage data locally for later exfiltration, aiding in data collection and exfiltration

securityImplications: Attackers might use ModifySnapshotAttribute to change permissions on Amazon EBS snapshots, potentially making them accessible to unauthorized users or public.
